review_title: Great place to work if you like engaging with students!
job_title: Temporary Hospitality Worker in Schenectady, NY
pros: Union College is a very small school so you will see the same students often ordering the same things! It is a really good job if you like working on a team and enjoy talking with young adults.
cons: Class schedules cause the dining hall to get really busy at one time. which can be overwhelming if there is a small staff.

pros: College environment is good, engaging with students is fun and every day is different
cons: Union College does not pay its staff well. Considering this is a private college, it's crazy how much we see money get funneled into unimportant buildings created specifically for trustees to have more meeting space, while staff continue to get absolutely shafted.

job_title: Work Study Student in Schenectady, NY

pros: The hours are flexible and you can often do school work while on the clock.
cons: The hourly is 9.25 and so you cannot support yourself easily on the wage.

pros: As an engineering student the work-study offered an engaging environment where I actually developed additional skills outside the classroom that were directly beneficial for my focus.
cons: Requires a lot of focus as if it was an additional engineering class/project so keep it in mind when taking on leadership positions.

job_title: Director of Student Activities in Schenectady, NY
pros: While the pay may be low, the consistent cost of living increases are nice and the access to a sizeable budget make getting the job done achievable. The PTO time earned is excellent and for Administrative staff there is no sick time - you just go go and do what you need to do when sick. A plus for sure.
cons: Human Resources is a challenge and the benefits are decreasing every year. There are no federal holidays, either.

pros: It’s very busy have a lot to do and goes by pretty fast you get free food
cons: It’s slow and workers are lazy

review_title: There is NO Community at Union College
pros: Benefits, but they have decreased as well
cons: Anyone who says that Union has a great sense of "Community" must be one of the high-up administrators trying to boost ratings on Glassdoor. The administration has no regards for staff members. None. Bottom line is the money for this administration and they implement cuts starting with the lowest level employees.

pros: Flexible hours and a good team of people to work with.

review_title: Great to work in a community of people that care about what they do.

cons: They pay less than for-profit businesses. Parents can be difficult. New administration arrives more frequently and will enact change for the sake of change.

job_title: Director of User Services in Clifton Park, NY
pros: There are good people in departments throughout the College.
cons: I was in a position of leadership at Union College and chose to leave Union in June after a 20-year career. The behaviors exhibited by senior leadership were nothing short of appalling. I and many co-workers were subjected to a hostile workplace that included bullying, verbal attacks, unethical financial behaviors, and physical confrontation that led to terrible morale and excessive turnover. Recent financial troubles have led Union to eliminate the 11% contribution to retirement accounts and to freeze or reduce salaries. I have stayed in touch with previous coworkers at Union and understand that the current situation in the IT department has deteriorated even further.

review_title: Former Senior Intern at Admissions Office
pros: Super friendly office where everyone excels at their job. You hardly feel like an intern working here. They are extremely considerate of your academic obligations and appreciative of the work you do for them (interviewing prospective students, staffing open houses, attending committee meetings). The professional development is priceless and you will likely grow a lot as a candidate in your future pursuits due to the interviewing experience you get working here. Excellent way to get an inside look at a pivotal aspect of how colleges' function.
cons: This is not the opportunity for you if you have a hard time managing your schedule and prioritizing your responsibilities. If you rely on steady compensation this may not be the best opportunity as some months you will have more hours while other months your hours can drop significantly.

pros: The school is small enough where you will often get a change to talk to any person on staff. In other words, your voice will be heard.
cons: The pay can be pretty low relative to other schools depending on your position. As a former RA, the pay was around half of what some other schools pay.

pros: Union College offers great benefits with respect to healthcare and education. Moreover, Union College provides its all of its employees with various HR programs and help.
cons: The HR issues with staff take the fun out of working in dining services and often times makes the job unnecessarily unbearable

review_title: Great Environment With Reasonable Responsibilities and Hardworking Employees
pros: Generally laidback environment, nice employees, beautiful campus, lots of opportunities to interact with students/coworkers and discuss books in the bookstore. Ideal position for extrovert/book lover.
cons: Bookstore got busy during odd times and then was completely dead, meaning work sometimes got boring. Students were sometimes a little rude when they were rushing, but not beyond anything else i’ve experienced in retail.

job_title: Writing Center Tutor in Schenectady, NY
pros: Accommodating, fair pay, flexible hours, countless jobs for any number of skills or departments specific to the potential employee. Great bosses, very mindful of the difficulties and challenges presented to students. Generally minimum wage or above, bi-weekly pay.
cons: Few jobs for students without "work study" accommodations. To be expected, the most jobs are given to those who are most financially in need.

review_title: Work study job with practical experience!
pros: The perks of working on a small college campus include access to great events, amenities, and the feel of a close-knit community.
cons: Because of the small size of the school it may be hard advance as I have seen first hand.

pros: Great community, you get to make connections with a wide variety of people who are awesome. The guaranteed single room is also a bonus along with the micro fridge.
cons: Pay is very low, you do not even receive full room and board off. Professional staff keep saying that they are trying, but to no avail.

review_title: Union College making progress as an employer, but still has further to go
pros: Pleasant environment, good opportunities to focus on research, students are good, teaching load is not too bad
cons: Performance/reward curve is not very steep, non-performers are "subsidized" by strong performers

review_title: Superb community for teaching and research
pros: Competitive salary, support and training for teaching and research, beautiful location
cons: Intense workload, longer academic year than most colleges due to term system
